reviews.text: The hostel seems quite new. It is kept very clean and tidy and is very comfortable to stay in. The staff were also quite friendly. The location of the the hostel isnt the greatest, but still not so bad. Also they have alot of big tourist groups like Top deck or something staying there which wasnt really to my taste. The internet was a bit iffy at times also. Overall not to bad though.
reviews.title: Nice hostel but big tourist groups stayin there.

reviews.text: My cousins and I stayed at St. Christopher's Paris for three nights in May 2011. The best parts of this hostel are the cozy little bunks we slept in. They each had their own outlets (to charge your electronics), a nightlight (to keep from waking your neighbors) and a sliding curtain to pull across the bunk for privacy. The three of us slept in a room with five other people, but the curtains really gave us a lot of privacy and kept the light out when others were coming and out of the room.
reviews.title: Best hostel we stayed at entire trip.

reviews.text: The security lockers (huge cages under each bed) were great. They fit most large suitcases! They're a little loud when you roll them out, but the security they offer you just can't find in most hostels. Bring your own lock!
reviews.title: Good experience in my first hostel

reviews.text: Most of the staff was friendly and helpful with directions, too!
reviews.title: Dorm in the Ghetto--outside Paris proper.

reviews.text: You can read more about our experience at http://missguidedtravel.blogspot.com
reviews.title: Do Not Stay Here

reviews.text: I had a sudden change of plans and had to find a room near the Gard du Nord, St Christopher's came up.
reviews.title: OK for a Quickie One-Night Stay

reviews.text: The good: Huge room for six people. There was a table, chairs, and a wash basin in the room. Room quite clean. Sheets already on the bed. Bed also good sized. Privacy curtain in front of bed. Own socket and lamp. Huge wire cage under bottom bed for storage. Big windows. Nice roommates.
reviews.title: Expensive, rude staff in terrible location

reviews.text: The bad: Big city indifferent staff. Only two bathrooms for 40 people on one floor. Shower had no curtain, so, if not careful, can spray water over the entire bathroom when showering. Very sketchy neighborhood (I had to walk it late at night and very early in the morning! Really scare-wee! ) The cage-like lockers needed BIG locks, which I didn't have.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.text: Conclusions: I stayed less than 6 hours, so my conclusions arise from just a limited stay. This hostel is convenient for the Gard du Nord and Gard de l"Est train stations (two stops on the metro Line 7), if one had to catch a train from those stations or take the RER B train to Charles de Gaulle Airport. It's relatively inexpensive for Paris lodgings. For what little sleep I got, I slept quite well. If it weren't for the large room and the cleanliness, this would easily qualify as the worst hostel I've ever stayed in. It's a very large hostel (300 beds) so it's always a possibility for last-minute bookings, as in my case.
reviews.title: Best hostel of the trip.

reviews.text: Stayed for 4 nights in June 2011. Nice room, clean and spacious with a sink. However the staff are too busy with their own social agenda to bother with good service. Always talking and messing around when there are lines of people. Also very rude at times. The linen was scratchy and the pillows weren't even pillows, but instead bags filled with cotton wool. The location is terrible, both in terms of distance from key sights and in socio economic terms! Would never walk around at night! Bathrooms dirty (poo on floor) and showers low pressure and require constant holding of a button for hot water. All in all a terrible waste of money.
reviews.title: Much better than expected, would definitely stay again!!

reviews.text: St Christopher's is an extremely large (and therefore somewhat impersonal) hostel, but it's run very professionally and I enjoyed my stay here. The rooms are very clean and modern looking, security is fine and there's a good balance between being able to meet other people and having your own space.
reviews.title: Good hostel

reviews.text: There's a bar/cafe on the ground floor which is handy - it's far enough away from the rooms that you won't have any trouble with noise. The only potential downside is the location, as it's quite far away from any recognised tourist area, but it's still a decent area and the metro is close by. I've stayed in lots of places in Paris and, believe me, there are a lot worse areas than this one!
reviews.title: Legit place!

reviews.text: Great place! The location is about a five to ten minute walk from the nearest metro, which is fine during the day, could be sketchy at night if alone. But don't let that discourage you. Once there, hostel is the jam!
reviews.title: get what you pay for!

reviews.text: Has a restaurant and bar with great food and you can watch football there too. Rooms are spacious and each bed has it's own spacious locker. (bring padlock)
reviews.title: Some things to know – like, bring ear plugs!

reviews.text: Beds also have drapes that can be drawn so you can seclude yourself if you wish.
reviews.title: Too Much Business, Not Enough Hostel

reviews.text: I stayed at St. Christopher's for 3 nights and was very pleased with my experience. The security key cards on the entrance, each floor, and individual rooms made me feel very secure as it restricted access to only those persons who needed to be in each area. I stayed in the female dorm and was glad I paid a little more (I think about $5) as it was clean and quiet.
reviews.title: Cleanest, Safest Hostel I've been to

reviews.text: I really appreciated the lockable luggage cages below my bed. They are a bit squeaky however, so they sometimes disturb a sleeping neighbor. The next time I would not choose the bed nearest the door, as I had to close the luggage cage every time someone came or went. I loved the privacy curtain which fully covered the bed area, blocking out light in the morning and offering privacy. It was fairly easy to string a small cord from either end of the bunk so I was able to dry small laundry and my bath towel during the day. Having A/C in a hostel is a rare thing, and I so appreciated it after each day out in the July heat.
reviews.title: Good place to crash for a hostel traveller

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cleanliness: Except for the bar downstairs, everything was very clean. Although so many travelers seem to wreak havoc on a place, the cleaning staff always seemed to restore the rooms and bathroom to a spotless state. The sheets were clean and crisp, the bathrooms were clean.
reviews.title: Oasis in The busy city

reviews.text: St. Christopher's has several additional features, such as free nightly concerts, a tv room, free self-serve breakfast, inexpensive dinners, an internet cafe (be prepared to wait in line) and a luggage room where you can stow your gear while waiting for a room or if you have time between checking out and heading to the airport.
reviews.title: Overall no huge complaints.

reviews.text: Belushi's Bar is a happening spot for visitors and 20-30 something locals, but beware the middle aged man trolling for young females. Great for a drink, but they cannot boast about the quality of their food or cleanliness. Breakfast is typically basic rolls with spread or jam, boxed cereal, fruit, and rough coffee. They view the idea of "dishwashing" used breakfast dishes very loosely. (i.e. I picked up a coffee cup that still had a thick residue of unmelted sugar in the bottom, and rarely encountered clean silverware.) The dinner specials are a joke, and I think you could do better eating at McDo's. I opted for it the first night and for about $10 managed to choke down leftover breakfast rolls and clumpy fettucine alfredo that tasted like it came from a 99 cent packet at the grocery store.
reviews.title: Just what i needed!
